summary: Clemard Joseph Charles was a Haitian banker and businessman who was a confidant of President Duvalier. He was of interest to the CIA and State Department, with assessments of his character and business dealings being conducted. The documents suggest that he was being considered as a potential political figure or asset. Later, he became involved in anti-government plotting against President Duvalier, leading to his imprisonment. The documents detail his alleged involvement in these plots, his imprisonment from 1969 to 1974, his health issues while imprisoned, and attempts to secure his release or medical treatment.
significance: The significance of Clemard Joseph Charles in the JFK context is not explicitly stated in the provided documents. The documents primarily focus on his political activities and relationships within Haiti during the 1960s and 1970s. There is no direct mention of any connection to the JFK assassination.
